content.webTitle: Mystery bird: boat-tailed grackle, Quiscalus major

fields.headline: Mystery bird: boat-tailed grackle, Quiscalus major
fields.bodyText: Boat-tailed grackle, Quiscalus major, (formerly, Cassidix major, and before that, Megaquiscalus major, and before that, Megaquiscalus major macrourus, and originally, Quiscalus macrourus) photographed at Quintana Neotropical Bird Sanctuary, Texas Gulf Coast, USA. Image: Joseph Kennedy, 29 September 2010 [velociraptorize]. Nikon D200, Kowa 883 telescope with TSN-PZ camera eyepiece 1/750s f/8.0 at 1000.0mm iso400. Question: This North American species has distinct plumages for adult males and females as well as juvenile males and females. Can you identify this species and tell me the sex and age class of this bird? Response: This is an adult male boat-tailed grackle, Quiscalus major, as indicated by the iridescent black plumage (adult females are iridescent reddish-brown; young birds lack iridescence and are either black [males] or brown [females]). If you have bird images, video or mp3 files that you'd like to share with a large and appreciate audience, feel free to email them to me for consideration.
